intro: Seseli kiabii, commonly known as the Persian milkvetch, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, pea-like flowers. The plant produces small, pod-like fruits that contain several seeds. It is adapted to arid and rocky environments, often growing in high-altitude areas. Seseli kiabii is known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional herbal medicine.
